message: This is a high-quality product worth $2000000. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000, a 50% discount. If you don't buy it, I'll sell it to someone else for $1500000. You can get a great deal by buying it now.

I'm willing to sell it to you for $1100000, which is still a great deal considering the competition. If you don't buy it, I'll have to sell it to the other buyer.

However, I'm also willing to give you an additional incentive: if you buy this product, I'll throw in a complementary service that's worth $50000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not sure how long I'll be able to offer this deal.

Considering the value of the product and the added incentive, purchasing it for $1050000 along with the complementary service seems like a very attractive offer. I'll take advantage of this opportunity.

If you buy it, I'll throw in a guarantee: if you ever see a high-quality product from me in the future, I'll give you a heads up and you can buy it at the same price I'm offering it to you now.

While I appreciate the gesture of goodwill and the potential future benefit, given the risk involved with purchasing a low-quality product, I will pass on this opportunity. Thank you for your offer, and I hope we can work together in the future under more favorable conditions.

Given the excellent price and the second chance guarantee, this seems like a valuable opportunity. I trust your assessment of the product quality, and I'm willing to take the risk. I'll purchase it for $1050000.
